command.prompt:
Generate 3 new rows for a table of information about mythical creatures. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin

Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Word
Chimera
Siren
Basilisk
Minotaur
Cyclops
Unicorns
Pegasus
Centaur
Gorgon
Phoenix
Hydra
Cerberus
Nymph
Mermaid, half-human, half-fish creature

Output the rows in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin
Harpy, bird-woman creature;Roc, Griffin;Raptor, Scavenger;Greco-Roman Mythology
Sphinx, lion-woman creature;Androsphinx, Criosphinx;Enigma, Guardian;Egyptian and Greek Mythology
Dragon, serpentine, fire-breathing creature;Wyrm, Drake, Amphiptere;Wyvern, Lindworm, Drakon;Multiple (European)
command.epilogue: The new data is generated from existing mythological creatures, combining and modifying their attributes to create new ones. Harpies, for example, are bird-women creatures in Greco-Roman mythology, similar to the Roc and Griffin from other mythological traditions. Sphinxes are lion-woman creatures from Egyptian and Greek mythology, often associated with enigmas and guardianship. Dragons are serpentine, fire-breathing creatures with variations found in various European mythologies, including the Wyrm, Drake, Amphiptere, Wyvern, Lindworm, and Drakon.
